meanings.definition: To make someone so frightened that they are unable to move or think
meanings.sent1: The loud thunderstorm outside can petrify my little sister.
meanings.sent2: The horror movie petrified the audience with fear.
meanings.sent3: The haunted house was so spooky, it could petrify even the bravest souls.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected sound of a door slamming shut can petrify someone in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence in the abandoned house seemed to petrify all who entered.

meanings.definition: To turn something into stone or a substance like stone
meanings.sent1: The ancient spell was said to petrify anyone who dared to enter the forbidden cave.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the mineral deposits can petrify the fallen tree trunk.
meanings.sent3: The wizard's potion accidentally petrified his own foot, turning it into solid rock.
meanings.sent4: The sculptor's skillful hands could petrify a block of marble into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The magical amulet had the power to petrify any living creature it touched.
